answers.answer: Medical devices are given to patients for a fixed or indefinite period, based on a medical prescription issued by a doctor in contractual relation with the health insurance house.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-devices and read the section under 'Medical devices'.

answers.answer: Medical prescriptions lose their validity if they are not submitted to the health insurance company within 30 days from the date of issue.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-devices and read the section under 'Medical devices'.

answers.answer: Medical devices are issued only by providers who are under contract with the health insurance house, either by purchasing or renting them.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-devices and read the section under 'Medical devices'.

answers.answer: An insured person may have to cover an amount of money for certain medical devices if their prices are higher than those settled by CNAS for that category of device.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-devices and read the section under 'Medical devices'.

answers.answer: The basic package includes ENT prosthetic devices, ostomy prosthetic devices, urinary retention and/or incontinence devices, limb prostheses, spine or limb orthoses, footwear orthopedics, devices for visual impairment, equipment for oxygen therapy and non-invasive ventilation, devices for aerosol therapy, walking devices, and external breast prostheses.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-devices and read the section under 'Medical devices'.

answers.answer: To initiate the process, the patient, a first or second degree relative, spouse, or legal representative submits an application to the health insurance house along with the required documents.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-devices and read the section under 'The procedure for obtaining the devices'.

answers.answer: Required documents include a copy of the ID, the medical prescription, and, if applicable, a classification certificate for oxygen therapy or non-invasive ventilation; for children up to 14, a medical prescription specifying the child's address and a copy of the birth certificate are needed.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-devices and read the section under 'The procedure for obtaining the devices'.

answers.answer: Application documents for medical devices can be sent to the health insurance house by post or online.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-devices and read the section under 'The procedure for obtaining the devices'.

answers.answer: The health insurance house is obliged to analyze and decide on the application within no more than 3 working days from its registration date.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-devices and read the section under 'The procedure for obtaining the devices'.

answers.answer: If requests for devices exceed the approved monthly fund, priority lists are established by device category.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-devices and read the section under 'The procedure for obtaining the devices'.

answers.answer: After approval, the patient or their representative contacts a contracted supplier during the decision's validity period, presenting the decision issued by the health insurance house and the medical prescription; documents can also be sent by post/courier.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-devices and read the section under 'The procedure for obtaining the devices'.

answers.answer: Beneficiaries of Emergency Ordinance no.15/2022, specifically foreign citizens or stateless persons from the armed conflict in Ukraine, are not requested any personal contribution for medical devices.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-devices and read the section under 'Medical devices'.
